summary: The Creative Relief and Expensing for Artistic Entertainment Act (CREATE Act) aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code to expand the ability to expense certain qualified productions. This includes increasing dollar limitations for expensing qualified productions (e.g., from $15 million or $20 million to $30 million or $40 million, respectively), adjusting these amounts for inflation starting in 2027, and extending the termination date for these provisions to December 31, 2030. These changes apply to productions commencing in taxable years ending after December 31, 2025.
